settings.title: Catchy heading
settings.text:
Use this section to create some callout text on your page, or add more details about your shop, services, promotions, etc.
You can keep the background color solid or use a background image instead.

settings.title: JOCO Reusable Cups
settings.text:
Thoughtfully designed and meticulously crafted to enhance your coffee ritual. Developed alongside world’s leading baristas.. and they know a thing or two about good coffee. Joco have created a cup that you can be proud of – for the rest of your life.

JOCO creates experience-enhancing and eco-innovative, reusable drinking vessels – the smartest choice for people and the planet.

Here at The Coffee Collective NZ, we are a proud stockist of Joco Cups. By encouraging another to steer away from disposable coffee cups then that in itself is a win for us. And not only do they help to reduce waste, but they certainly enhance your favourite beverage with their sleek designs.

Whether you are into a Macchiato or a Latte, we have sizes to suit. Starting from the little 4oz Joco coffee cups and increasing with sizes 6oz, 8oz and 12oz cups. They also come in a great range of colours to suit your style! Check them out online at The Coffee Collective, delivering nationwide.

settings.title: We are coffee roasters & hospitality experts.
settings.text:
As a coffee company we get to build friendships with a huge variety of interesting and talented people who are embarking on new adventures every day. From coffee lovers through to coffee farmers, we get to connect these people and it is such a humbling and inspiring privilege.

Since starting out in 1998, we have invested in our product, people and community. Back then we were just three passionate people roasting out of a small shop in a provincial New Zealand surf town.

View Ozone Coffee Roasters range online at The Coffee Collective below, including Coffee Blends, Single Origin, Organic and Decaf Coffee!

settings.promo_text: Description of promotion with lots of details.

settings.content_text:
Get in touch with the team!

Check out our FAQ's here for assistance. 

However, if your enquiry is still not answered please contact us using this form. We will endeavour to respond to your enquiry within 24 hours.

Our Click & Collect / Store hours are:
Monday - 9:00am - 1:00pm
Tues - Friday: 10:00am - 12:00pm
Saturday & Sunday: Closed
Public Holidays: Closed

We are located C3 27 William Pickering Drive, Albany, Auckland. (Look for Simplicity Loyalty Building as we share an office).

*Please do not turn up outside of these hours as we are not always in the office. Alternatively get in touch with the team and we can advise with availability.

settings.title: How fresh will my coffee be?
settings.answer:
Your coffee will be delivered to you freshly roasted, direct from each of our coffee partners.

Due to this, you may receive separate parcels should you purchase coffee across brands.

settings.title: What is the shipping cost?
settings.answer:
Our shipping fees are as follows: 

Auckland: $4.99

Rest of North Island: $5.49

South Island: $5.99

Rural*: $8.99

Coffee & Equipment orders freight will be double as you will receive multiple packages with coffee being roasted and dispatched directly from our roasting partners.

*Please use this option if you are sending your order to a rural address. Additional fees may apply if not used.

settings.title: When will my order arrive?
settings.answer:
If your order is being sent direct from our fulfilment centre, it should arrive overnight to 3 working days.

If you are purchasing coffee, your order will be roasted and shipped directly from the respective roaster(s).

In some instances, with more than three bags of coffee ordered, this order may be consolidated whereby please allow 3-6 working days.

settings.title: What courier(s) do you use?
settings.answer: The majority of parcels are sent with Courier Post/ NZ Post for a timely delivery.

settings.title: Do you deliver to a Rural Address?
Do you deliver to a PO Box?
What payment options are accepted?
settings.answer:
We process all payments through 3D Secure - Shopify Payment Gateway.

Payment options include Visa, Mastercard, America Express, Shopify Pay, Apple Pay and Google Pay.

We also have the option to checkout using Laybuy.

settings.title: Which currency will I be charged?
settings.answer:
You will be charged in New Zealand Dollars (NZD).

All prices displayed on our website include Goods and Services Tax (GST).

settings.title: What is your Returns/ Exchanges policy?
settings.answer:
Returns / Exchanges
Our returns/exchange policy lasts 30 days. If 30 days have gone by since your purchase, unfortunately we can’t offer you store credit or an exchange. 

To be eligible for a return, your item must be unused and in the same condition that you received it. It must be in the original packaging, stickers, tags etc attached.

Several types of goods are exempt from being returned. These items include: 
- Gift cards 
- Coffee
- Clearance items

To complete your return, we ask you to send us a message via our contact form, stating the reason. We will then review your request and be in contact with you. 

If the product you have purchased is faulty and the warranty is still current, we ask if you can send us an email with images/ videos outlining the issue where we will then advise next steps to get this resolved for you. If the product get accepted under warranty, you will be provided with a replacement product or store credit. Please email us at info@thecoffeecollective.co.nz

You will be responsible for paying for your own shipping costs for returning your item. Shipping costs are non-refundable. If you receive a store credit, this will only extend to the goods and not the original freight charge.

settings.title: What is your Warranty process?
settings.answer:
If the product you have purchased is faulty and the warranty is still current, we ask if you can send us an email with images/ videos outlining the issue where we will then advise next steps to get this resolved for you. If the product get accepted under warranty, you will be provided with a replacement product or store credit. Please email us at info@thecoffeecollective.co.nz

You will be responsible for paying for your own shipping costs for returning your item. Shipping costs are non-refundable. If you receive a store credit, this will only extend to the goods and not the original freight charge.

settings.title: What is your Privacy Policy?
settings.answer:
The Coffee Collective are committed to maintaining the highest level of security of our customer information.

The purpose of The Coffee Collective's Privacy Policy will inform you with what information we collect, how we collect it and how is used and managed in accordance with the New Zealand Privacy Act. 

At the end of the day, you can be assured that when shopping with us we have your privacy at the forefront of our business practices.

Types of information we may collect:

- Name
- Email address
- Mailing or street address
- Location
- Telephone number
- Gender
- Details of the products you have purchased from us
- Any additional personal information that you provide to us directly or indirectly through our websites, apps, social media
- Information you provide to us through our customer contact centre, customer surveys

How we collect Information:

- Register an account on our website
- Place an order online
- Contact us
- Participate in a promotion
- Subscribe to our newsletter or product notifications
- When you browse through our website offering
- You accept cookies and other tracking technologies on your device
- You interact with our Social Media, i.e liking, commenting or sharing posts or through the private messenger

How we use your information:

- To process and fulfil your order, including to send you emails to confirm your order status and shipment

- To communicate with you and provide information on existing or new products
- To help us learn more about your shopping preferences
- To administer and carry out our promotions
- To help us analyse our website efficiency, products and trends
- To protect the security of our website and business
- To contact you if necessary

settings.title: How do I update my information?
settings.answer:
You will be able to add/ edit your address once logged into your customer account. 

Should you need to change your email address, please contact us via our contact form and we will be able to assist.

settings.title: Do you use cookies?
settings.answer:
In order to complete your purchase with The Coffee Collective, you will need to have cookies enabled. "Cookies" are essentially small data files that are stored on your computer.

Cookies are an important part in e-commerce, where we use them to mitigate security risks and enhance your online shopping experience.

settings.title: How do I find my subscription?
settings.answer: Find the instructions on how to access your subscription here.

settings.title: Will I be automatically charged?
settings.answer:
As part of the subscription, you will be automatically charged every month.

You will be able to opt out of this before your next payment date via your account. If you are struggling to access your account, contact the team here and we will re-send your account invitation.

settings.title: Can I cancel my subscription?
settings.answer:
Yes, of course. You will be able to cancel your subscription at any time. This is done by logging in to your account.

Please see the instructions here on how to access your subscription.

If you are struggling to access your account, contact the team here and we will re-send your account invitation.

settings.title: Is there a rewards program?
settings.answer: We do have rewards for our loyal customers - watch your inboxes and don't miss 'Coffee Rewards' emails! 🎁

settings.title: Society Coffee
settings.text:
Society Coffee is a New Zealand micro-specialty coffee roaster that works with people who share the same value to quality and philosophy of delivering a specialty coffee experience. 

We are not just about the coffee - it’s about the people. Passionate people

Here at Society Coffee, we represent a group of people who were brought together through their passion toward coffee. From growing to harvesting, roast to brew, design and serve.

settings.title: Want to add a Gift Message?
settings.text:
Click the button below to add a gift message for your order!
*Please note: Not applicable to orders containing coffee as they are generally shipped direct from our roasting partners.

settings.title: Less Sugar, More Cocoa
settings.text: We use only the highest quality Ghanaian cocoa. Our recipe is lower in sugar compared with most hot chocolate found in NZ cafes. The end result is creamy and rich, with none of the overly sweet characteristics that other drinking chocolates offer. Just super balanced and delicious.

settings.title: Heading
settings.text: Text area can be used for details about blog authors or general information.
Find what you seek.

settings.title: Meebz Coffee Roasters
settings.text:
Meebz coffee Roasters is a boutique coffee roasting company based on Auckland’s North Shore.

We love coffee and our passion is to ensure our customers find their favourite taste whether you are enjoying one from our own espresso bar, or from one of our hand selected café partners. 

At any one-time we will have over 20 different coffee offerings including specialty, organic and rain forest-alliance coffee. Our sources extend worldwide and our coffee is often sourced from smaller farms such as cooperatives, small estates and microlots.

settings.title: Monthly Coffee Discovery Boxes
settings.text: With The Coffee Collective's Monthly Discovery Boxes, you will get to explore coffee from a fantastic line-up of premium New Zealand Coffee Roasters. Customise your box to suit your favourite brewing method.

settings.title: Selecting Your Box:
settings.text:
One:
Decide which of the boxes you are most interested in. Whether you prefer drinking Blended Coffee, Single Origin or Decaffeinated Coffee. Select one of the products below.

Two:
Pick the style of the coffee you would like to receive. Be it Whole Beans, Espresso Grind, Plunger Grind or Filter Grind.

Three:
You are now ready to checkout! If this is your first box, then use the code 'DISCOVER' at checkout to get 10% off. Boxes are dispatched on the 1st of each month.

settings.title: Manage Your Subscription
settings.text:
For more information on your subscription/ how to edit or opt out click here.

Alternatively our team is always here for you to get in touch with. Get in touch with us via our contact form here.

settings.title: The Coffee Collective NZ
settings.text: For all coffee loving, yet extremely busy households and businesses, The Coffee Collective is your solution!

settings.title: Sup Cups NZ
settings.text:
As a family owned and operated business located in the Bay of Islands we are passionate about reducing the use of disposables and single use plastic in NZ.

Our products are aimed at making sustainability fun and easy through funky colours & designs that will make you want to be using them everyday. Goodbye disposables, hello Sup Cups!

settings.title: Frank Green
settings.text:
Frank Green was founded in Melbourne, one of the world’s coffee capitals, by serial entrepreneur, caffeine enthusiast and passionate environmental advocate, Benjamin Young. 

Frank Green is a philosophy. They are passionate about doing better by our planet, by reducing single-use coffee cups and replacing them with something stylish, well-designed and convenient. 

Their cups and bottles are made of premium, safe materials. In just 15 uses you will offset the environmental impact it took to create your Frank Green.

Get one for yourself and find out why Frank Green has grown into one of Australia’s most loved reusable cups and bottles brands and is rapidly expanding around the world!

Here at The Coffee Collective, we are proud to bring you Frank Green Reusable cups and bottles for your morning coffee, tea and range of other drinks you want to keep hot, or keep cold throughout the day. In a great selection of colours, find one that suits your style!

Our range includes that of the Frank Green 10oz Ceramic Reusable Cups, Original 12oz Reusable Cups, 20oz Ceramic Bottles and 25oz Original Water Bottles. 

Check them out below! Click Here for the full range.

Blog pieces:

- Frank Green introduction Click Here
- Push-top lid instructions Click Here

settings.title: About Flight Coffee
settings.text:
Since 2009, Flight Coffee is a family of driven people that work together to produce amazing coffee, while always aiming to have the best impact we can on the industry and the lives it connects. 

Our focus is on coffee appreciation, education, and development. Check out their fantastic range below, including Coffee Blends and Single Origin Coffee.

settings.pretext: Check out this video of the Flight Coffee team at
settings.title: The Hangar
About Bodum
settings.text:
For over 70 years Bodum have had a simple vision - to provide high quality coffee and tea solutions to households. Bodum was founded in Denmark in 1944 by Peter Bodum.

Bodum continues to innovate and create wonderful designs for affordable prices whilst keeping an eye on sustainability, environmental responsibility, and respect for the wellbeing of their staff, communities, and planet. - "Good design doesn’t have to be expensive,"Peter Bodum.

View The Coffee Collective's range of world-renowned homewares from Bodum, including coffee makers and glassware.

settings.title: Espresso Workshop Coffee Roasters
settings.text:
Espresso Workshop was founded in 2007 on the principle of unlocking the flavour potential of specialty coffee, advocating the merits of unique flavour profiles and the promotion of premium single origin coffee.

The goal of Espresso Workshop is to demonstrate that coffee is not just a product but an experience. Coffee obsessed, sometimes fanatical, but we reckon that this focus on the product only inspires us to produce better coffee.

Here at The Coffee Collective NZ, we are stoked to bring you the fantastic range of Blends, Single Origin and Decaf Coffee's from our friends at Espresso Workshop. Check out our range below.

settings.title: Buy a Gift Card
settings.text: The perfect gift for all coffee lovers. Let the lucky recipient choose what they want, from a bag of fresh coffee to a reusable cup to serve that delicious brew in.

settings.title: What's New at The Coffee Collective:
Cafetto - A cleaning product for every machine
settings.text:
Cafetto® produces cleaning and sanitation products for espresso, coffee brewing and beverage dispensing equipment. Cafetto® is the industry leader in effective organic and eco-friendly solutions, offering cleaning products to improve equipment performance and simplify cleaning processes. Through its extensive product portfolio and global network, Cafetto® provides cleaning products to both the commercial and domestic markets.

Benefits of cleaning your equipment:
• Improve machine and equipment performance
• Increase the life span of the machine
• Increase machine reliability
• Reduce service downtime
• Improve flavour of coffee

settings.title: Traditional Espresso Machine Cleaners
settings.text:
Daily use of an espresso machine cleaner on commercial machines will reduce the frequency of machine services, lengthen the lifespan of your machine and improve the quality of coffee extraction.

Cafetto® has a comprehensive range of high performance cleaners that are formulated to clean espresso machine group heads, valves and lines. Cafetto’s espresso machine cleaning powders remove coffee oils, grounds and stains, improving the taste and aroma after the machine is cleaned.

Espresso Clean 500g - Click Here

EVO 500g (Organic) - Click Here

settings.title: Super Automatic Cleaning Tablets
settings.text:
Different brands and styles of super automatic espresso machine are unique and require a cleaning tablet with a specific dissolution time, size and shape.

Cafetto F20 Cleaning Tablets 100 Pack - Click Here

Cafetto J25 Cleaning Tablets 60 Pack - Click Here

Cafetto S15 Cleaning Tablets 8 Pack - Click Here

Cafetto S15 Cleaning Tablets 100 Pack - Click Here

settings.title: Milk Cleaners
settings.text:
The MFC® range has been developed to sanitise, remove milk residue and hard water scale from milk lines and frothers. Whether you’re dealing with hard water or need a cleaner that can break down build up from milk-based products, Cafetto® has a product suited to your requirements with both alkaline and acidic products on offer.

Acidic milk cleaners are specially formulated for hard water conditions. Acidic cleaners deliver high levels of effective scale removal while sanitising. Milk lines must be flushed with water before use with acidic cleaners.

Shop MFC Red - Click Here

Alkaline cleaners provide excellent cleaning capabilities for heavy milk deposits in instances where there is a build-up of milk in the milk lines. Alkaline cleaners are recommended for machines using dairy products that are high in fat such as full cream milk, cream or ice cream. They also control scale when used frequently.

Shop MFC Blue 1L - Click Here

settings.title: Descaler Powder & Liquids
settings.text:
Why Descale? Scale build-up causes equipment downtime leading to increased machine service frequency, more part replacements and a shortened machine lifespan. Scale build-up also reduces the quality of espresso flavour.

Cafetto® has a comprehensive range of high performance and eco-friendly descalers to suit both service technicians and home users. Check the them out here at The Coffee Collective NZ.

Cafetto LOD Red 1L - Click Here
An eco-friendly, highly concentrated liquid descaler which rapidly and easily removes lime scale and calcium build up. LOD Red has been developed for use on machines with heavy scale build up and for service technicians.

Cafetto Restore Sachets - Click Here
A safe and effective eco-friendly powder descaler for removing hard water scale from espresso machine boilers, coffee and milk delivery lines.

Cafetto Spectra Descaler - Click Here

An eco-friendly powder descaler which visually indicates whether a descaling cycle has been successful using pH-sensitive dye compounds. Orange indicates an effective descaling cycle, and blue indicates that another descaling cycle is required.

settings.title: Grinder Cleaners
settings.text:
Cleaning the internal components of a coffee grinder are often overlooked or deemed unnecessary. However, cleaning the internals will remove build up of stale coffee residue, odours and reduce blockages between burrs and chutes. Cleaning will also improve grinder performance and extend the working life of its burrs.

Cafetto Grinder Clean Sachets - Click Here

settings.title: General Cleaning & Accessories
settings.text:
Maintaining completely clean equipment requires premium cleaning accessories. Cafetto® offers a range of accessories to support a clean and healthy machine with a focus on simplifying the cleaning process.

Cafetto Inverso Sachets - Click Here
Return shine to milk jugs, crockery and cutlery. This unique formula of enzymes is versatile removing fat, oil, and grime build up from stainless steel surfaces and accessories, leaving a shiny finish without the scrubbing.

Cafetto Eco Capsule Clean - Click Here

Thoroughly cleans the brewing chamber and delivery spout in Nespresso®* capsule coffee machines. Eco Capsule Clean is a biodegradable Nespresso®- compatible capsule containing certified organic cleaning powder.

settings.title: Coffee Brewing Equipment
settings.text: Get lost within our wonderful collection equipment from world-renowned brands. Including premium speciality coffee makers, coffee grinders, scales, through to classy reusable coffee cups that will make your morning cuppa even more enjoyable.
